intro: Sievekingia hirtzii, commonly known as the hairy sieve-plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Sievekingia hirtzii is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
